references.reason: This paper introduced LDA, a foundational topic model widely used in text analysis and a key concept related to the current paper's goal of explaining datasets through interpretable parameters.
This paper extended LDA to model time-series data, which is directly relevant to the current paper's application of time-series modeling with natural language parameters.
This paper pioneered the idea of using natural language to parameterize latent variables in statistical models, a central concept behind the current paper's approach.

references.paper_title: Describing differences between text distributions with natural language
references.reason: This paper, by the first author of the current paper, laid the groundwork for using LLMs to generate interpretable descriptions of data distributions, which is a crucial component of the current work.

references.paper_title: Goal-driven explainable clustering via language descriptions
references.reason: This paper, by a co-author of the current paper, introduced a method for explainable text clustering that the current work builds upon and compares to.
